channel.title: New Computer
channel.description:
I was thinking about buying a new computer, but cheap.. My price range was $200-$400.. I found a e machines one. [code]CPU1 : Intel® Atom™ Processor 230 (1.6GHz, 512KB L2 cache, 533MHz FSB) Operating System : Genuine Microsoft® Windows® XP Home SP2 Chipset : Intel® 945GC Express Memory2 : 1024MB DDR2 (1 × 1024MB) 1 DDR2 slot (total), 0 DDR2 slots (available) Hard Drive3 : 160GB SATA Optical Drive4 : 18x DVD±R/RW SuperMulti drive featuring Labelflash™ Write max: 18x DVD±R, 6x DVD-RW, 8x DVD+RW, 8x DVD±R DL, 12x DVD-RAM, 48x CD-R, 32x CD-RW Read max: 16x DVD-ROM, 48x CD-ROM Supports Labelflash™ on disk printing Video2 : Integrated Intel® Graphics Media Accelerator 950 Audio : Embedded high-definition Communications : 56k ITU v.92-ready fax/modem (RJ-11 port) 10/100 Ethernet LAN (RJ-45 port) Peripherals : eMachines® PS/2 keyboard PS/2 optical mouse Ports/Other : 8 - USB 2.0 (4 front, 4 rear) 2 - PS/2 (keyboard and mouse) 1 - VGA 2 - Audio: headphone (stereo), microphone 3 - Audio ports 1 - RJ-45 Ethernet 1 - RJ-11 modem 1 - Parallel port 1 - Serial port Dimensions : 10.7" H x 4.2" W x 15" D Weight : 12 lbs. (system unit only) Warranty5 : 1-year parts and labor limited warranty with toll-free tech support Software : Genuine Microsoft® Windows® XP Home eMachines® Recovery Center Productivity Software Microsoft Works® 9.0 Microsoft Office Home and Student 2007 (60-day complimentary trial period)6 Adobe® Reader® Adobe® Flash® Player Digital Media Software CyberLink® LabelPrint™, supporting LabelFlash™4 Connectivity/Utilities Google Toolbar™ and Desktop Search™ eMachines® Comprehensive Security Norton Internet Security™ 2009 (60-day trial)7 Price : $229.99[/code] Source: http://emachines.com/products/products.html?prod=EL1600-01
Is that any good? I would like to stick with something cheap.. And that looks pretty nice, plus I can get more RAM if needed, or a external hard drive.

item.title: New Computer
item.dc:creator: @Explisionist Explisionist
item.description:
@Explisionist wrote:

[quote=“Niall, post:18, topic:319496”]Very bad! If you don’t mind building it yourself:

ZOTAC IONITX-D-E $154.99
Crucial 2GB (2 x 1GB) $37.99
Western Digital 500GB $54.99
ABS Mini-ITX Case w/ 200W Power Supply $34.99
Sony CD/DVD r-rw drive $69.99

Total: $357.95

Ok that was a lot more expensive than I thought, but for it you get an Intel Atom N330 Dual Core 1.6 GHz processor with an Ion from Nvidia capable of HD video playback as well as wifi support. I wouldn’t recommend it as I quickly got the links from newegg, but if you shop around you can get a really good deal.

Also if size isn’t an issue I’d go for a regular sized computer, it won’t cost as much.[/quote]
I started looking again… I may go with a hp or something…

Read full topic

item.title: New Computer
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Very bad! If you don’t mind building it yourself:

ZOTAC IONITX-D-E $154.99
Crucial 2GB (2 x 1GB) $37.99
Western Digital 500GB $54.99
ABS Mini-ITX Case w/ 200W Power Supply $34.99
Sony CD/DVD r-rw drive $69.99

Total: $357.95

Ok that was a lot more expensive than I thought, but for it you get an Intel Atom N330 Dual Core 1.6 GHz processor with an Ion from Nvidia capable of HD video playback as well as wifi support. I wouldn’t recommend it as I quickly got the links from newegg, but if you shop around you can get a really good deal.

Also if size isn’t an issue I’d go for a regular sized computer, it won’t cost as much.

Read full topic

You get what you pay for.

It has a expandable pack for RAM… Also its $229 on the site, buy it online from newegg.com and its $189… Thats not that much for it… And the monitor is on their site with it.

item.title: New Computer
item.dc:creator: @Explisionist Explisionist
item.description:
@Explisionist wrote:

I hate a alienware laptop… Its the mx17… And if you would read my first post you would see why I am going with something cheap.

@Fat_Cookies, I rather have a desktop just to sit at my house and not be moved, or disconnected.
Also its for a game that I have been working on for awhile.

Read full topic

item.title: New Computer
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

GOD… E machines is shit they are not worth your time.

Either buy if you have low amounts of cash and not enough for an Alien Ware:

Gateway
Acer
HP

That’s all I can think of at the minute. :’(

Read full topic

item.title: New Computer
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

Buy a netbook and hook it up to an external monitor. That is a much better idea because it has a the same performance, but when you want you can have portability.
I have a asus eee pc, and its brilliant. If you want to use it has a dedi server, you can install linux and just close the lid and hook it up with Ethernet.

What exactly are you planning to host anyway?

Read full topic

item.title: New Computer
item.dc:creator: @reverce reverce
item.description:
@reverce wrote:

[quote=“Explisionist, post:4, topic:319496”][quote author=reverce link=topic=415958.msg3059900#msg3059900 date=1260764226]
Its nicé but w8 few months and get some more cash Because that processor is crap; vidocard is cheap one Taught ,
nice sound card well, I dont know that 299 dollar is mutch for a computer in America , but in Europe Its enormous cheap and probably junk
Also If your planning to buy It remove the xp and put windows 7 on it (pm me to get it , u can have it free from me) bought it but ripped it so be free to ask. idk if my advice helped , hope you get allot of envoy in your new computer.
[/quote]
Windows 7 is shit. I got enough cash to buy a computer of any sort… I got a alienware laptop already… Just looking for a desktop since I don’t got one… No point in spending out a shit load on a comp I will only use to host something on…[/quote]
Oh ok , than that one is perfect enouh ram for good host.
